job.title: Team Coordinator and Philanthropy Advisor , 9 months - Zürich

company.name: Médecins Sans Frontières / Ärzte ohne Grenzen

job.plaincontent:
MSF Suisse : Team Coordinator and Philanthropy Advisor , 9 months - Zürich
for Individual Major Donors in German speaking Switzerland and Liechtenstein
9 months, 100%
Context
MSF is a non-profit, international, independent, medical-humanitarian organization providing assistance to people affected by conflict, epidemics, natural disasters, or exclusion from healthcare. MSF’s teams are made up of health professionals, logisticians and administrative personnel, guided by medical ethics and the principles of impartiality, independence and neutrality. MSF was founded in 1971 in Paris by a group of journalists and doctors. Today, it is a worldwide movement of more than 42,000 people, including staff in headquarters and in the field. MSF Switzerland was created in 1981 and it is headquartered in Geneva. The Philanthropy Unit is one of the seven units at the Communications and Fundraising Department. It is composed of 15 people and it raised CHF 70M in 2019. To ensure a good geographical coverage of the Swiss fundraising market, the Unit is divided into two offices: Geneva and Zurich. The Unit’s mission is to strengthen MSF’s relationship with its private major supporters, including wealthy individuals, companies, foundations, and other philanthropic organisations. It also manages grants and donations from Swiss cantons and communes. Last but not least, it is also in charge of legacy fundraising, including management of heritages as well as contacts with potential legators and confirmed bequestors.
Responsibility
The Team Coordinator and Philanthropy Advisor for individual major donors in German speaking Switzerland and Liechtenstein is a key position in the Philanthropy Unit. S/he is personally responsible for raising funds from individual major donors in German speaking Switzerland and Liechtenstein and coordinates individual major donors fundraising in the whole Switzerland, by managing a team of Philanthropy Advisors for that purpose, including Zurich and Geneva. With the Head of Unit, s/he’s in charge of designing the general strategy and guarantees the implementation of annual action plans for each portfolio of major donors. The Team Coordinator and Philanthropy Advisor will secure and grow income for MSF from individual major donors in German speaking Switzerland and Liechtenstein. Expected income: from CHF6M to CHF10M per year.
Main tasks
Strategy and action plan
- In accordance with the Head of unit, steer and coordinate the strategy for individual major donors fundraising in Switzerland and Liechtenstein. - Develop and implement an individually donor-tailored action plan for the renewal or upgrading of contributions from current major donors and for the acquisition of new ones. - Contribute to the strategic mapping and general annual plan of action of the Communications and Fundraising Department.
Cultivation and stewardship
- Prepare and facilitate one to one meetings, calls, presentations and other meaningful interactions with major donors or representatives (lawyers, wealth managers, etc.) - After prospection, establish relations with new potential major donors, including ultra-high-net-worth individuals, to secure significant future support for MSF’s work - Interact and collaborate with key managers within MSF (President, General Director, Director of Operations, other management team members), as well as field staff, with the aim of bringing donors closer to the organisation in an attempt to show them our live saving mission and work in the projects. - Define, propose and organise field visits for major donors, according to MSF approved criteria and policies. - Ensure that the moves management runs smoothly, and donors are thanked and steward properly. - Liaise with Writing Officers for the preparation, including proof reading and editing, of project briefings, reports, proposals, slideshows, infographics and any other creative way of presenting MSF and its mission to high net worth individuals.
Solicitation
- Present and defend MSF’s cases for support to individual major donors in German speaking Switzerland. - Ensure that the major donors journey strategy is followed and that major donors are solicited according to their motivations in a personalised way.
Team coordination and management
- Supervise and guide the work of 2 Philanthropy Advisors for individual major donors in Geneva and Zurich. - Plan annual quantitative (revenue) and qualitative objectives of the members of her/his team in agreement with the Head of the unit. - Monitor the team's activity on a daily basis, set their priorities and provide the necessary support and coaching - Propose and implement tools to increase the efficiency of her/his team's activity, including improving procedures and promoting best practices - Identify Human Resources needs (employees, trainees, volunteers) within her/his and with the head of the unit ensure their recruitment
Others
- Actively participate in the International Working Group of Major Donors at MSF movement level. - Represent MSF in Swiss Fundraising events and other professional gatherings with peer professionals from other organisations and entities. - Work proactively on projects as needed in the Unit, upon request by her/his supervisor.
Your Profile
Education
- University degree in Business Management, Marketing, Communications, Political Science, Law, International Relations or equivalent
Experience
- Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in similar functions or in the fields of marketing/sales/communication/journalism or high-level relational skills, like public relations or wealth management - Humanitarian experience: a plus
Competencies
- Proven writing skills (drafting and editing) - Excellent in oral public presentations - Excellent knowledge of the Windows environment (Word, Excel, Power Point) and databases
Languages
- Fluent in both (Swiss-) German and English - Good understanding of French - Italian : a plus
Personal qualities
- Excellent interpersonal skills - Negotiation and persuasive skills - Dynamic, proactive and autonomous - Rigorous and good organizational skills - Empathic, enthusiastic, optimistic - Team spirit
Terms of Employment
- Fixed-term contract of 9 months, 100% - Based in Zürich - Ideal starting date : mid-August 2020 - Gross annual salary: from CHF 90’576.- to CHF 103’932.- (salary commensurate with experience and according to internal salary grid)
How to apply
Candidates submit their application following the requirements: CV 2 p. max. – letter of motivation 1p. max. – in English only . Closing date for application is 19th July 2020.
APPLY HERE
The applications will be treated confidentially. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted .

for Individual Major Donors in German speaking Switzerland and Liechtenstein

9 months, 100%

Context

MSF is a non-profit, international, independent, medical-humanitarian organization providing assistance to people affected by conflict, epidemics, natural disasters, or exclusion from healthcare. MSF’s teams are made up of health professionals, logisticians and administrative personnel, guided by medical ethics and the principles of impartiality, independence and neutrality. MSF was founded in 1971 in Paris by a group of journalists and doctors. Today, it is a worldwide movement of more than 42,000 people, including staff in headquarters and in the field.
MSF Switzerland was created in 1981 and it is headquartered in Geneva. The Philanthropy Unit is one of the seven units at the Communications and Fundraising Department. It is composed of 15 people and it raised CHF 70M in 2019. To ensure a good geographical coverage of the Swiss fundraising market, the Unit is divided into two offices: Geneva and Zurich. It also manages grants and donations from Swiss cantons and communes. Last but not least, it is also in charge of legacy fundraising, including management of heritages as well as contacts with potential legators and confirmed bequestors.

With the Head of Unit, s/he’s in charge of designing the general strategy and guarantees the implementation of annual action plans for each portfolio of major donors.
The Team Coordinator and Philanthropy Advisor will secure and grow income
for MSF from individual major donors in German speaking Switzerland and Liechtenstein. Expected income: from CHF6M to CHF10M per year.

Main tasks

Strategy and action plan

  • In accordance with the Head of unit, steer and coordinate the strategy for individual major donors fundraising in Switzerland and Liechtenstein.
  • Develop and implement an individually donor-tailored action plan for the renewal or upgrading of contributions from current major donors and for the acquisition of new ones.
  • Contribute to the strategic mapping and general annual plan of action of the Communications and Fundraising Department.

Cultivation and stewardship

  • Prepare and facilitate one to one meetings, calls, presentations and other meaningful interactions with major donors or representatives (lawyers, wealth managers, etc.)
  • After prospection, establish relations with new potential major donors, including ultra-high-net-worth individuals, to secure significant future support for MSF’s work
  • Interact and collaborate with key managers within MSF (President, General Director, Director of Operations, other management team members), as well as field staff, with the aim of bringing donors closer to the organisation in an attempt to show them our live saving mission and work in the projects.
  • Define, propose and organise field visits for major donors, according to MSF approved criteria and policies.
  • Ensure that the moves management runs smoothly, and donors are thanked and steward properly.
  • Liaise with Writing Officers for the preparation, including proof reading and editing, of project briefings, reports, proposals, slideshows, infographics and any other creative way of presenting MSF and its mission to high net worth individuals.

  • Present and defend MSF’s cases for support to individual major donors in German speaking Switzerland.
  • Ensure that the major donors journey strategy is followed and that major donors are solicited according to their motivations in a personalised way.

Team coordination and management

  • Supervise and guide the work of 2 Philanthropy Advisors for individual major donors in Geneva and Zurich.
  • Plan annual quantitative (revenue) and qualitative objectives of the members of her/his team in agreement with the Head of the unit.
  • Monitor the team's activity on a daily basis, set their priorities and provide the necessary support and coaching
  • Propose and implement tools to increase the efficiency of her/his team's activity, including improving procedures and promoting best practices
  • Identify Human Resources needs (employees, trainees, volunteers) within her/his and with the head of the unit ensure their recruitment

Others

  • Actively participate in the International Working Group of Major Donors at MSF movement level.
  • Represent MSF in Swiss Fundraising events and other professional gatherings with peer professionals from other organisations and entities.
  • Work proactively on projects as needed in the Unit, upon request by her/his supervisor.

Your Profile

Education

  • University degree in Business Management, Marketing, Communications, Political Science, Law, International Relations or equivalent

Experience

  • Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in similar functions or in the fields of marketing/sales/communication/journalism or high-level relational skills, like public relations or wealth management
  • Humanitarian experience: a plus

Competencies

  • Proven writing skills (drafting and editing)
  • Excellent in oral public presentations
  • Excellent knowledge of the Windows environment (Word, Excel, Power Point) and databases

Languages

  • Fluent in both (Swiss-) German and English
  • Good understanding of French
  • Italian : a plus

Personal qualities

  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Negotiation and persuasive skills
  • Dynamic, proactive and autonomous
  • Rigorous and good organizational skills
  • Empathic, enthusiastic, optimistic
  • Team spirit

Terms of Employment

  • Fixed-term contract of 9 months, 100%
  • Based in Zürich
  • Ideal starting date : mid-August 2020
  • Gross annual salary: from CHF 90’576.- to CHF 103’932.- (salary commensurate with experience and according to internal salary grid)

How to apply

Candidates submit their application following the requirements: CV 2 p. max. – letter of motivation 1p. max. – in English only.
Closing date for application is 19th July 2020.
APPLY HERE

The applications will be treated confidentially.
Only short-listed candidates will be contacted .

job.title: Junior Compliance Officer for Fund and Asset Management
job.plaincontent:
Junior Compliance Officer for Fund and Asset Management #153660Switzerland-Switzerland - Region Zurich-Zürich | Full-time (FT) | Corporate Functions |
Job ID
153660Legal & ComplianceEnglish
Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.
We Offer
- An exciting and meaningful role as a Compliance Officer covering the Fund Management and Control Review Group of Asset Management Switzerland - Provide oversight and control over compliance and regulatory risks - Advise on Governance related topics of the organization or products - Protect the interests of the investors with respect to conflict of interest and fair conduct of business activities - Advise in prevention and mitigation of compliance breaches - Maintain, oversee, develop and execute the compliance program (incl. policies, training, monitoring and enforcement) - Promote compliance and set standards by advising and assisting the Management and its employees in their day to day business activities - Monitor business activities based on regular and ad-hoc compliance risk assessments - Conduct Testing of Business areas (e.g. Desk or Thematic Reviews) - Interaction with several internal and external stakeholders such as portfolio management, risk management, internal and external audit - Be part of a forward-thinking team whose team spirit and specific expertise guarantee an exciting working environment and growth opportunities; join our dynamic team now!
You Offer
- Are you looking for an exciting new challenge and would describe yourself as an empathetic and positive personality with a solution oriented ability and can-do attitude? Are you a motivated and dedicated person, passionate about team work and working in a fast-paced environment? Then you would be the perfect fit for our team! - Bank apprenticeship or a college/university degree in law or economics - Minimum 2 years of experience in the financial industry, preferably in the Asset Management, Investment Fund or Management Company area - Excellent written and oral communication skills in German and English - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills - Effective interpersonal, organizational, communication and coordination skills - Advanced MS Office skills
*LI-CSJOB* Ms. S. Eugster would be delighted to receive your application. Please apply via our career portal.
Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.
job.htmlcontent:
Junior Compliance Officer for Fund and Asset Management #153660Switzerland-Switzerland - Region Zurich-Zürich |   Full-time (FT) | Corporate Functions | 

Job ID

 153660Legal & ComplianceEnglish

Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.

We Offer

 
  • An exciting and meaningful role as a Compliance Officer covering the Fund Management and Control Review Group of Asset Management Switzerland
  • Provide oversight and control over compliance and regulatory risks 
  • Advise on Governance related topics of the organization or products
  • Protect the interests of the investors with respect to conflict of interest and fair conduct of business activities 
  • Advise in prevention and mitigation of compliance breaches 
  • Maintain, oversee, develop and execute the compliance program (incl. policies, training, monitoring and enforcement)
  • Promote compliance and set standards by advising and assisting the Management and its employees in their day to day business activities
  • Monitor business activities based on regular and ad-hoc compliance risk assessments 
  • Conduct Testing of Business areas (e.g. Desk or Thematic Reviews)
  • Interaction with several internal and external stakeholders such as portfolio management, risk management, internal and external audit
  • Be part of a forward-thinking team whose team spirit and specific expertise guarantee an exciting working environment and growth opportunities; join our dynamic team now!

You Offer

 

 

  • Are you looking for an exciting new challenge and would describe yourself as an empathetic and positive personality with a solution oriented ability and can-do attitude? Are you a motivated and dedicated person, passionate about team work and working in a fast-paced environment? Then you would be the perfect fit for our team!
  • Bank apprenticeship or a college/university degree in law or economics
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in the financial industry, preferably in the Asset Management, Investment Fund or Management Company area 
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills in German and English
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Effective interpersonal, organizational, communication and coordination skills
  • Advanced MS Office skills
*LI-CSJOB*
Ms. S. Eugster would be delighted to receive your application.
Please apply via our career portal.

 

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

job.title: Asset Manager Real Estate Europe
job.plaincontent:
Asset Manager Real Estate Europe #153111Switzerland-Switzerland - Region Zurich-Zürich | Full-time (FT) | Private Banking and Wealth Management |
Job ID
153111Product SpecialistEnglish
Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.
We Offer
As a specialized global asset manager, we take an entrepreneurial approach to sourcing opportunities. We offer targeted solutions across the equity, fixed income, multi-asset, real estate, infrastructure and alternative asset classes, covering a range of approaches and styles. We employ top investment talents focused on matching the interests and needs of investors to the fast-paced opportunities of tomorrow's markets.
- A challenging position within Global Real Estate, one of the largest European property fund managers with successful track record in global direct real estate investments. We offer comprehensive and tailor-made solutions and innovative products for institutional-, UHNWI- and retail clients. - Responsibility for the Asset Management of a core to value-add real estate portfolio located in Germany and other selected European countries - Duty to proactively guide and control external service providers such as property managers, leasing agents, development managers, advisors and JV partners - Budget responsibility on property and portfolio level - Drafting and executing development, property and leasing strategies with the goal to enhance property values and secure stable and sustainable cash-flows - Key Tenant Management - Responsibility to manage lease negotiation processes - Initiation and monitoring of refurbishments and capital expenditure projects - Active risk management and responsibility for the data quality delivered from our external service providers - Performing commercial due diligences and supporting during the acquisition process - You join a visionary team, whose team spirit and specific expertise guarantee an exciting working environment and growth opportunities. We are open to discuss flexible/ agile working.
You Offer
- Are you a dedicated and highly motivated individual who establishes effective relationships with key partners and can make things happen? Then, join us to develop our business and expand the frontier of modern Asset Management. - You have a (university) degree or equivalent, preferably in Real Estate Management/Economics or as Architect, Civil Engineer with additional training in Real Estate - Several years of experience in the real estate industry and preferably the asset management of also value-add properties - Experience in developing and executing strategies for the repositioning of properties - Experience in lease negotiations - Basic knowledge of technical installations - Able to display high levels of creativity, attention to details and initiative and proven ability to produce results in a fast paced environment - Excellent team-skills and willingness to constantly improve processes, templates and introduce new possible solutions within a growing environment - Readiness to travel - Experience of managing projects in a JV structure is of an advantage - You are fluent in German and English. Additional European languages are of an advantage.
*LI-CSJOB*Ms. F. Zimmermann would be delighted to receive your application. Please apply via our Career Portal.
Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.
job.htmlcontent:
Asset Manager Real Estate Europe #153111Switzerland-Switzerland - Region Zurich-Zürich |   Full-time (FT) | Private Banking and Wealth Management | 

Job ID

 153111Product SpecialistEnglish

Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.

We Offer

 
As a specialized global asset manager, we take an entrepreneurial approach to sourcing opportunities. We offer targeted solutions across the equity, fixed income, multi-asset, real estate, infrastructure and alternative asset classes, covering a range of approaches and styles. We employ top investment talents focused on matching the interests and needs of investors to the fast-paced opportunities of tomorrow's markets.
  • A challenging position within Global Real Estate, one of the largest European property fund managers with successful track record in global direct real estate investments. We offer comprehensive and tailor-made solutions and innovative products for institutional-, UHNWI- and retail clients.
  • Responsibility for the Asset Management of a core to value-add real estate portfolio located in Germany and other selected European countries
  • Duty to proactively guide and control external service providers such as property managers, leasing agents, development managers, advisors and JV partners
  • Budget responsibility on property and portfolio level
  • Drafting and executing development, property and leasing strategies with the goal to enhance property values and secure stable and sustainable cash-flows
  • Key Tenant Management
  • Responsibility to manage lease negotiation processes
  • Initiation and monitoring of refurbishments and capital expenditure projects
  • Active risk management and responsibility for the data quality delivered from our external service providers
  • Performing commercial due diligences and supporting during the acquisition process
  • You join a visionary team, whose team spirit and specific expertise guarantee an exciting working environment and growth opportunities. We are open to discuss flexible/ agile working.

You Offer

 
  • Are you a dedicated and highly motivated individual who establishes effective relationships with key partners and can make things happen? Then, join us to develop our business and expand the frontier of modern Asset Management.
  • You have a  (university) degree or equivalent, preferably in Real Estate Management/Economics or as Architect, Civil Engineer with additional training in Real Estate
  • Several years of experience in the real estate industry and preferably the asset management of also value-add properties
  • Experience in developing and executing strategies for the repositioning of properties
  • Experience in lease negotiations
  • Basic knowledge of technical installations
  • Able to display high levels of creativity, attention to details and initiative and proven ability to produce results in a fast paced environment
  • Excellent team-skills and willingness to constantly improve processes, templates and introduce new possible solutions within a growing environment
  • Readiness to travel
  • Experience of managing projects in a JV structure is of an advantage
  • You are fluent in German and English. Additional European languages are of an advantage.
*LI-CSJOB*Ms. F. Zimmermann would be delighted to receive your application.
Please apply via our Career Portal.

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

job.title: Diplomierte Expertinnen & Experten Intensivpflege 50-100%
job.plaincontent:
per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung
Deine Hauptaufgaben
- Dein Herz schlägt für die Spitzenmedizin? Dich erwartet bei uns eine professionelle, vielseitige und interessante Tätigkeit. Du kannst jeden Tag dazulernen und aktiv mitgestalten! - Du arbeitest gerne selbstständig? Pflegerische Interventionen planst, organisierst und führst Du selbstständig aus! - Du denkst und arbeitest über den eigenen Tellerrand hinaus? Uns ist eine interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit wichtig! - Du arbeitest gerne in gemischten Teams? Bei uns arbeitest Du im Skill- und Grademix, sprich mit Kollegen unterschiedlicher Ausbildungsstufen, unterschiedlicher Berufserfahrungen sowie individuellen Fähigkeiten! - Der intensivpflegerische Nachwuchs ist für Dich von Bedeutung? Unsere Studierenden der NDS Intensivpflege werden auch von Dir begleitet um von Deinem Know-How zu profitieren!
Dein Profil
- Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Nachdiplomstudium der Intensivpflege oder eine gleichwertige Weiterbildung gemeistert und damit bereits Deine Eintrittskarte für unser Institut für Intensivmedizin gelöst - Falls Du aus dem Ausland kommst, so bitten wir Dich Dein Grund-Diplom vom SRK (Schweizerischen Roten Kreuz) anerkennen zu lassen - Nicht nur fachlich hast Du was zu bieten, sondern auch persönlich kannst Du glänzen. Deine Social Skills beherrschst Du mindestens genauso gut wie Deine Fachlichen - Arbeitsspitzen zu bewältigen gehört genauso zu Deiner beruflichen Leidenschaft wie auch der routinierte Alltag - Deine optimistische Lebenseinstellung und humorvolle Art ermöglichen Dir auch in turbulenteren Zeiten ein Lächeln im Gesicht zu behalten
Unser Angebot
Unsere sechs Intensivstationen zeichnen sich aus durch motivierte, multikulturelle Teams, in denen Du nicht nur Zusammenarbeit, sondern auch Zusammenhalt erleben wirst. Von den Vorgesetzten wird Dir Dein Rücken freigehalten, Du bekommst Unterstützung und erhältst ehrliches, direktes Feedback für Deine Arbeit. Dabei sind Gerechtigkeit, Verlässlichkeit sowie Verbindlichkeit zentrale Werte, die von uns gelebt werden. Dadurch gelingt es uns auch intensivere Zeiten gemeinsam zu meistern und sich aufeinander verlassen zu können.
Spitzenmedizin erfordert einen hohen Anspruch an die Pflegequalität. Jeden Tag geben wir dafür unser Bestes, wobei jeder Einzelne unterschiedlich dazu beitragen kann. Der ideale Stärken-Mix im Team, von «hoch-technisch» bis «hoch-empathisch» ermöglicht uns eine hohe Leistung zu geben. Was kannst Du besonders gut?
Du bist gefragt! Wir sind offen für Deine Meinung, denn nur so können wir uns entwickeln und verbessern. Persönlich wie fachlich sollst Du bei uns auch weiterkommen können. Wir fördern Deine Laufbahn durch ein umfassendes Bildungsangebot am USZ. Und damit die Arbeitszeiten besser für Dich passen, geben wir unser Bestes, persönliche Wünsche in der Gestaltung des Dienstplans zu berücksichtigen.
Haben wir Dich neugierig gemacht? Dann freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!
Übrigens: Du bist schon länger nicht mehr im Beruf aktiv gewesen? Wir möchten gern mit Dir zusammen eine individuelle Lösung finden für Deinen Wiedereinstieg in die Intensivpflege! Mehr
Weitere Auskünfte
Für Fragen steht Dir Frau Simone Stein, Leiterin Pflegedienst, gerne zur Verfügung. 043 254 03 74simone.stein@usz.ch
Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!
Pascal Stöckli HRM Recruiting

Du bist gefragt! Wir sind offen für Deine Meinung, denn nur so können wir uns entwickeln und verbessern. Persönlich wie fachlich sollst Du bei uns auch weiterkommen können. Wir fördern Deine Laufbahn durch ein umfassendes Bildungsangebot am USZ. Und damit die Arbeitszeiten besser für Dich passen, geben wir unser Bestes, persönliche Wünsche in der Gestaltung des Dienstplans zu berücksichtigen.

Haben wir Dich neugierig gemacht? Dann freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Übrigens: Du bist schon länger nicht mehr im Beruf aktiv gewesen? Wir möchten gern mit Dir zusammen eine individuelle Lösung finden für Deinen Wiedereinstieg in die Intensivpflege! Mehr

Weitere Auskünfte

Für Fragen steht Dir Frau Simone Stein, Leiterin Pflegedienst, gerne zur Verfügung. 043 254 03 74simone.stein@usz.ch

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Pascal Stöckli
HRM Recruiting

job.title: Diplomierte Pflegefachperson HF auf der IPS 80-100%
job.plaincontent:
per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung
Deine Hauptaufgaben
- Dein Herz schlägt für die Spitzenmedizin? Dich erwartet bei uns eine professionelle, vielseitige und interessante Tätigkeit. Du kannst jeden Tag dazulernen und aktiv mitgestalten! - Du arbeitest gerne selbstständig? Nach einer vierwöchigen 1:1 Einführung wirst Du selbstständig Patienten betreuen können, welche Deinem Kompetenzprofil entsprechen. Du arbeitest ausserdem im Tandem mit einem Dipl. Experten der Intensivpflege - Du denkst und arbeitest über den eigenen Tellerrand hinaus? Uns ist eine interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit wichtig! - Du arbeitest gerne in gemischten Teams? Bei uns arbeitest Du im Skill- und Grademix, sprich mit Kollegen unterschiedlicher Ausbildungsstufen, unterschiedlicher Berufserfahrungen sowie individuellen Fähigkeiten!
Dein Profil
- Deine Ausbildung zur Dipl. Pflegefachperson hast Du in der Tasche und konntest mind. 1 Jahr in einem Akutspital arbeiten - Falls Du aus dem Ausland kommst, so bitten wir Dich, Dein Grund-Diplom vom SRK (Schweizerischen Roten Kreuz) anerkennen zu lassen - Nicht nur fachlich hast Du was zu bieten, sondern auch persönlich kannst Du glänzen. Deine Social Skills beherrschst Du mindestens genauso gut wie Deine Fachlichen - Arbeitsspitzen zu bewältigen gehört genauso zu Deiner beruflichen Leidenschaft wie auch der routinierte Alltag - Deine optimistische Lebenseinstellung und humorvolle Art ermöglichen Dir auch in turbulenteren Zeiten ein Lächeln im Gesicht zu behalten
Unser Angebot
Unsere sechs Intensivstationen zeichnen sich aus durch motivierte, multikulturelle Teams, in denen Du nicht nur Zusammenarbeit, sondern auch Zusammenhalt erleben wirst. Von den Vorgesetzten wird Dir Dein Rücken freigehalten. Du bekommst Unterstützung und erhältst ehrliches, direktes Feedback für Deine Arbeit. Dabei sind Gerechtigkeit, Verlässlichkeit sowie Verbindlichkeit zentrale Werte, die von uns gelebt werden. Dadurch gelingt es uns auch intensivere Zeiten gemeinsam zu meistern und sich aufeinander verlassen zu können.
Spitzenmedizin erfordert einen hohen Anspruch an die Pflegequalität. Jeden Tag geben wir dafür unser Bestes, wobei jeder Einzelne unterschiedlich dazu beitragen kann. Der ideale Stärken-Mix im Team, von «hoch-technisch» bis «hoch-empathisch» ermöglicht uns eine hohe Leistung zu geben. Was kannst Du besonders gut?
Du bist gefragt! Wir sind offen für Deine Meinung, denn nur so können wir uns entwickeln und verbessern. Persönlich wie fachlich sollst Du bei uns auch weiterkommen können. Wir fördern Deine Laufbahn durch ein umfassendes Bildungsangebot am USZ. Und damit die Arbeitszeiten besser für Dich passen, geben wir unser Bestes, persönliche Wünsche in der Gestaltung des Dienstplans zu berücksichtigen.
Haben wir Dich neugierig gemacht? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung! Mehr
Weitere Auskünfte
Für Fragen steht Dir Frau Simone Stein, Leiterin Pflegedienst, gerne zur Verfügung. 043 254 03 74simone.stein@usz.ch
Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung
Pascal Stöckli HRM Recruiting

job.title: Mitarbeiter Zollabteilung Import (m/w/d) 100%
job.plaincontent:
Seien Sie ein Teil von uns.
Mitarbeiter Zollabteilung Import (m/w/d)
100%
Die Menschen stehen bei ALDI SUISSE im Mittelpunkt: als Kundinnen und Kunden, als Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter. Dieses Bekenntnis ist ein wesentlicher Teil unseres Erfolgs. ALDI SUISSE ist ein führendes Schweizer Detailhandelsunternehmen mit einem breiten Filialnetz in allen drei Sprachregionen des Landes.
Ihre Aufgaben
- Vorbereitung und Übermittlung von Einfuhrzollanmeldungen (CH Import) - Abklärung von zoll- und aussenhandelsrechtlichen Vorschriften - Kontakt mit Zollbehörden, Lieferanten und Speditionen - Administrative Aufgaben
Ihr Profil
- Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung (kaufmännische Ausbildung von Vorteil) - Fachwissen im Schweizer Zollwesen und Erfahrung im Bereich Zoll (Import) - Fundierte e-dec (Import) Kenntnisse - Versierter Umgang mit MS-Office Anwendungen - Schnelle Auffassungsgabe, ausgeprägtes Zahlenflair - Selbstständige und exakte Arbeitsweise - Hohe Leistungsbereitschaft, Kontaktfreude und Teamgeist
Unser Angebot
- Eine umfassende Einarbeitung - Eine sichere und langfristige Anstellung in einem spannenden Umfeld - Aus- und Weiterbildung im Rahmen der ALDI SUISSE Akademie - Attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen - Ein freundliches Arbeitsklima und übersichtliche Strukturen - Ein moderner Arbeitsplatz am Hauptsitz von ALDI SUISSE
Arbeitsort
9536 Schwarzenbach, Niederstettenstrasse 3
Arbeitsbeginn
nach Vereinbarung
Online Bewerbung
Nutzen Sie bitte unsere Online-Bewerbung und fügen Sie Ihren Lebenslauf inklusive Motivationsschreiben, Foto und sämtlichen relevanten Zeugnissen bei.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer C++ (f/m/d) for Terrestrial Laser Scanners
job.plaincontent:
Committed, dynamic and with a passion for precision, we revolutionise the world of measurement and survey.
Around the globe, customers from all industries rely on our smart technologies. You want to support us in engineering and implementing powerful software without losing track of your target but always staying cool? Join our team and make your visions come true!
Senior Software Engineer C++ (f/m/d) for Terrestrial Laser Scanners
Heerbrugg
This appeals to you
- Development of robust and efficient cross-platform applications using latest C++ standards and Qt libraries - Participate in all the stages of the development process, including research, design, implementation, integration, testing and deployment - High performance and real-time realizations of terrestrial laser scanning workflows with focus on various embedded hardware platforms - Responsibility to setup qualification tests to ensure image quality and implement quality improvements within the whole imaging pipeline (for example using HDR) - Ensuring the product quality by writing software on high standards, using automated tests and establish a state-of-the-art CI/CD infrastructure - Technical coaching of co-workers and promote excellent SW engineering practices - You would like to gain first insight in our reality capture products? Watch
This is you
- A relevant university qualification (Master, PhD) in computer science, mathematics or engineering - Several years' experience in an agile software development using languages such as modern C++ and Python - Strong software engineering background (design patterns, clean code and TDD) and willingness to contribute to the architecture and design of the software components - Basic knowledge within the area of imaging processing (like video capture and imaging pipeline processing principles) - Knowledge in the area of GPU's (OpenCL, OpenCV, CUDA) would be beneficial - Experience within CI/CD infrastructure, cmake and conan is also considered an asset - Strong communication skills in English and German, experience to work within an intercultural and distributed located agile environment
About Us
Our innovative solutions and products are characterised by the highest efficiency and reliability. Help us to improve the future and join us working on a global success story. Find out more about and become part of something bigger.
How can I apply
If you are interested in this challenging and varied position, then we look forward to receiving your online application! Due to the privacy policy, we accept applications only via the application form. In case you are a recruitment agency please contact .
Leica Geosystems AG Heinrich Wild Strasse CH-9435 Heerbrugg Job-ID: 7a655oqt
job.htmlcontent:
Committed, dynamic and with a passion for precision, we revolutionise the world of measurement and survey.

Around the globe, customers from all industries rely on our smart technologies. You want to support us in engineering and implementing powerful software without losing track of your target but always staying cool? Join our team and make your visions come true!

Senior Software Engineer C++ (f/m/d) for Terrestrial Laser Scanners

Heerbrugg

This appeals to you

  • Development of robust and efficient cross-platform applications using latest C++ standards and Qt libraries
  • Participate in all the stages of the development process, including research, design, implementation, integration, testing and deployment
  • High performance and real-time realizations of terrestrial laser scanning workflows with focus on various embedded hardware platforms
  • Responsibility to setup qualification tests to ensure image quality and implement quality improvements within the whole imaging pipeline (for example using HDR)
  • Ensuring the product quality by writing software on high standards, using automated tests and establish a state-of-the-art CI/CD infrastructure
  • Technical coaching of co-workers and promote excellent SW engineering practices - You would like to gain first insight in our reality capture products? Watch 
 

This is you

  • A relevant university qualification (Master, PhD) in computer science, mathematics or engineering
  • Several years' experience in an agile software development using languages such as modern C++ and Python
  • Strong software engineering background (design patterns, clean code and TDD) and willingness to contribute to the architecture and design of the software components
  • Basic knowledge within the area of imaging processing (like video capture and imaging pipeline processing principles)
  • Knowledge in the area of GPU's (OpenCL, OpenCV, CUDA) would be beneficial
  • Experience within CI/CD infrastructure, cmake and conan is also considered an asset
  • Strong communication skills in English and German, experience to work within an intercultural and distributed located agile environment

About Us

Our innovative solutions and products are characterised by the highest efficiency and reliability. Help us to improve the future and join us working on a global success story. Find out more about and become part of something bigger.

How can I apply

If you are interested in this challenging and varied position, then we look forward to receiving your online application! Due to the privacy policy, we accept applications only via the application form. In case you are a recruitment agency please contact .

Leica Geosystems AG
Heinrich Wild Strasse
CH-9435 Heerbrugg

job.title: Assistante diplômée ou Assistant diplômé en droit européen
job.plaincontent:
Introduction
Institution d’enseignement et de recherche de premier plan au niveau international, l’UNIL compte près de 5’000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs et 15’500 étudiant·e·s, réparti·e·s entre le campus de Dorigny, et les sites du CHUV et d’Epalinges. En tant qu’employeur, elle encourage l’excellence, la reconnaissance des personnes et la responsabilité.
www.unil.ch/carrieres
Présentation
Afin de compléter son équipe, la Chaire de droit européen de l'Ecole de Droit de la Faculté de droit, des sciences criminelles et d'administration publique est à la recherche de deux Assistant·e·s diplômé·e·s.
Informations liées au poste
Entrée en fonction : 01.09.2020 ou à convenir
Durée du contrat : 1 année, renouvelable 2 x 2 ans, soit une durée maximale de 5 ans
Taux d'activité : 70%
Lieu de travail : CDCEI, Université de Lausanne, site de Dorigny
Vos activités
- 50% pour la réalisation d'une thèse de doctorat sur l'un des thèmes de recherche de la Chaire (droit de l'UE, en particulier droit constitutionnel et droit de l'asile et de l'immigration; relations Suisse-UE; européisation du droit et des politiques suisses) - 50% pour l'assistanat (soutien à l'enseignement et à la recherche de la Chaire)
Votre profil
Cette opportunité est destinée à des personnes détentrices d'un Master en droit :
- disposant de bonnes connaissances en matière de droit européen et/ou de relations entre la Suisse et l'UE; des connaissances ou un intérêt prononcé et démontrable pour les thèmes de recherche de l'unité (cf. ci-dessus) constitutent un atout supplémentaire - ayant des capacités rédactionnelles démontrées en français et une bonne connaissance de l'anglais; une bonne connaissance de l'allemand constitue un atout supplémentaire - ayant un fort intérêt pour la recherche et une forte motivation pour la rédaction d'une thèse de doctorat; des expériences de recherche, voire des publications, constituent un atout supplémentaire - maîtrisant les outils bureautiques - organisé·e, autonome et précis·e
Nous offrons d'excellentes conditions de travail dans un Centre dynamique de l'Université de Lausanne.
Vos avantages
Un cadre de travail agréable dans un environnement académique multiculturel et diversifié. Des possibilités de formation continue, une multitude d'activités et d'autres avantages à découvrir.
Davantage d'informations sur www.unil.ch/carrieres
Pour tout renseignement complémentaire
Prof. Francesco Maiani francesco.maiani@unil.ch
Votre dossier de candidature
Délai de postulation : 15.07.2020
Les personnes intéressées sont priées de nous faire parvenir via le système en ligne, dans un seul document en format PDF (votreNom.pdf) , un dossier complet contenant : une lettre de motivation, un CV, une copie des relevés des notes (université et relevé des notes de la maturité) et une version électronique d'un texte que vous avez rédigé.
Il ne sera pris en compte que les candidatures adressées par le biais du site « Unil Emplois ».
Nous vous remercions de votre compréhension.
Remarques
L’UNIL s’engage pour l’égalité. www.unil.ch/egalite
L'UNIL soutient la relève scientifique. www.unil.ch/graduatecampus
job.htmlcontent:
Introduction

Institution d’enseignement et de recherche de premier plan au niveau international, l’UNIL compte près de 5’000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs et 15’500 étudiant·e·s, réparti·e·s entre le campus de Dorigny, et les sites du CHUV et d’Epalinges. En tant qu’employeur, elle encourage l’excellence, la reconnaissance des personnes et la responsabilité.

www.unil.ch/carrieres

Afin de compléter son équipe, la Chaire de droit européen de l'Ecole de Droit de la Faculté de droit, des sciences criminelles et d'administration publique est à la recherche de deux Assistant·e·s diplômé·e·s.

Durée du contrat : 1 année, renouvelable 2 x 2 ans, soit une durée maximale de 5 ans

  • 50% pour l'assistanat (soutien à l'enseignement et à la recherche de la Chaire)
Votre profil

Cette opportunité est destinée à des personnes détentrices d'un Master en droit :

 

  • disposant de bonnes connaissances en matière de droit européen et/ou de relations entre la Suisse et l'UE; des connaissances ou un intérêt prononcé et démontrable pour les thèmes de recherche de l'unité (cf. ci-dessus) constitutent un atout supplémentaire
  • ayant des capacités rédactionnelles démontrées en français et une bonne connaissance de l'anglais; une bonne connaissance de l'allemand constitue un atout supplémentaire
  • ayant un fort intérêt pour la recherche et une forte motivation pour la rédaction d'une thèse de doctorat; des expériences de recherche, voire des publications, constituent un atout supplémentaire
  • maîtrisant les outils bureautiques
  • organisé·e, autonome et précis·e

 

Nous offrons d'excellentes conditions de travail dans un Centre dynamique de l'Université de Lausanne.

Vos avantages

Un cadre de travail agréable dans un environnement académique multiculturel et diversifié.
Des possibilités de formation continue, une multitude d'activités et d'autres avantages à découvrir.

Davantage d'informations sur www.unil.ch/carrieres

Pour tout renseignement complémentaire

Prof. Francesco Maiani
francesco.maiani@unil.ch

Délai de postulation : 15.07.2020

Les personnes intéressées sont priées de nous faire parvenir via le système en ligne, dans un seul document en format PDF (votreNom.pdf),  un dossier complet contenant : une lettre de motivation, un CV, une copie des relevés des notes (université et relevé des notes de la maturité) et une version électronique d'un texte que vous avez rédigé.

Il ne sera pris en compte que les candidatures adressées par le biais du site « Unil Emplois ».

Nous vous remercions de votre compréhension.

Remarques

L’UNIL s’engage pour l’égalité.
www.unil.ch/egalite

L'UNIL soutient la relève scientifique.
www.unil.ch/graduatecampus

Mitarbeiter Verkauf (m/w/d)
50%
Die Menschen stehen bei ALDI SUISSE im Mittelpunkt: als Kundinnen und Kunden, als Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter. Dieses Bekenntnis ist ein wesentlicher Teil unseres Erfolgs. Ready to take your next career step?
Hapa AG is the world's leading supplier of innovative printing solutions for packaging processes in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries. As a steadily expanding Swiss SME headquartered in Volketswil near Zurich with its own sales and service offices worldwide, Hapa AG belongs to Coesia, a globally active group of innovation-oriented companies for industrial solutions based in Bologna, Italy.
We are looking for a young, dynamic and motivated person as a
Import/Export Specialist (temporary 6 months)
Main tasks and responsibilities
- Organizing transportation and export custom clearance for machines, spare parts and consumables (inks and solvents – dangerous goods) + clarifying popping up issues - Handling Letters of credit (Checking / submission of LC compliant documents) - Creating certificates of origin - Application and processing of Carnet ATA - Determination of preferential origin of goods shipped out - Pricing transportation and additional related services - Handling of claims in connection with transport damage and forward other complaints to the responsible Department - Implementation of a lean improvements in department area
Your Profile
- IATA DG PK1 Training - Foreign trade specialist with federal diploma of professional education and Training - Well-founded training in the export-/import-/forward/customs sector - Minimum of 3 years experience in foreign trade / international shipments - Good knowledge of English (business fluent) - German language skills are an advantage - Good computer skills (ERP, SharePoint, Microsoft Office) - Balanced, loyal and reliable person - Resilient, keeps track even in hectic times - Conscientious & helpful
Our offer to you
You can expect an interesting and very independent activity in a small and motivated team and in an innovative and successful company. Hapa AG offers you an attractive and future-oriented workplace with training opportunities and up-to-date employment conditions. Flat hierarchies and a great working atmosphere in a very collegial environment complete our offer.
Have we sparked your interest?
We look forward to receiving your completed application exclusively in electronic form here via our job portal.
If you have any questions regarding this opening, please contact:
Hapa AG, Mr. Massimo Lolli, Human Resources, Chriesbaumstrasse 4, 8604 Volketswil
www.hapa.ch

job.title: Mitarbeiterin / Mitarbeiter Kiosk / Restaurant 50%
job.plaincontent:
Das Spital Uster ist das vernetzte und leistungsfähige Diagnose- und Therapiezentrum des Zürcher Oberlandes und des Glattales. Pro Jahr vertrauen rund 60'000 Patientinnen und Patienten auf unsere Fachkompetenz, das breite Leistungsspektrum und die fortschrittliche Infrastruktur. Wir sind der grösste Arbeitgeber von Uster und bieten unseren 1'300 Mitarbeitenden ein spannendes Arbeitsumfeld.
Für unseren Kiosk mit integrierter Geschenksboutique und einem separaten Blueme-Egge und Restaurant suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine/einen
Mitarbeiterin / Mitarbeiter Kiosk / Restaurant 50%
Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehören
- Sie sind mitverantwortlich für das Angebot am Kiosk und in der Geschenksboutique - Geschenke verpacken und dekorieren - Bedienen der internen und externen Kunden - Übernehmen von kleineren Reinigungsaufgaben - Auffüllen des Sortiments - Selbständiges Bedienen und Abrechnen der Kasse - Durchführen und Mitarbeit bei verschiedenen internen und externen Anlässen - Erledigen von Reinigungsarbeiten gemäss HACCP - Bei Bedarf mit Hilfe und Betreuung des Selbstbedienungsrestaurants - Sicherstellung von Mise en place sowie der Warenpräsentation
Wir erwarten
- Abgeschlossene Ausbildung im Detailhandel und oder in der Gastronomie sowie mehrjährige ausgewiesene Berufserfahrung - Lösungsorientierte, und selbstständige Persönlichkeit - Hohe Eigeninitiative, Verantwortungsbewusstsein, Organisationstalent sowie ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und kreatives Flair - Sehr gute Umgangsformen sowie ein sicheres und gepflegtes Auftreten - Bereitschaft zum Schicht- und Wochenenddienst - Sehr gute PC-Anwenderkenntnisse
Wir bieten
- Vielseitige und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit - Selbstständiges Arbeiten sowie Unterstützung durch ein kompetentes, dienstleistungsorientiertes und motiviertes Team - Anstellung nach kantonalen Richtlinien inkl. einer zusätzlichen Ferienwoche - Möglichkeiten zur Weiterbildung und individueller Förderung - Eigenes Personalrestaurant - Gute Erreichbarkeit mit dem ÖV
Ihre Ansprechperson Informationen finden Sie hierWir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung. Es werden ausschliesslich Online-Bewerbungen auf unserer Homepage www.spitaluster.ch/karriere im Inserat unter "jetzt bewerben" berücksichtigt. Papierdossiers werden nicht retourniert.

job.title: Data Officer for Digital Chemistry, NCCR Catalysis

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Data Officer for Digital Chemistry, NCCR Catalysis
Your mission : The NCCR Catalysis (Sustainable Chemical Processes Through Catalyst Design, www.snf.ch/en/researchinFocus/nccr/catalysis) has the ambition to make the production of commodity chemicals and fuels sustainable and carbon neutral, and therefore to contribute to mitigate climate change. ETHZ will be leading house and EPFL co-leading house, with many other Swiss educational centers participating. The mission of the data officer will be to develop a scalable research data management system based on data standardization, storing, sharing, and processing in the field of catalysis research. You will be part of the NCCR management team office located at ETHZ, whereas yourself will be at EPFL. You will be located within the Institute of Chemical Sciences and Engineering (ISIC, https://www.epfl.ch/schools/sb/research/isic/) at EPFL, and will have a privileged interaction as well with the Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC, https://datascience.ch/). Motivated and qualified candidates should submit their application online before 01.09.2020 . The CV should contain the list of technical and scientific skills, previous professional experience, education, copy of the PhD degree and names and contact details of at least 3 references. The motivation letter should highlight past experience which could be exploited for the position and interest for the position. Applications which are incomplete or not submitted in the required format will not be considered. Main duties and responsibilities include :
- Drive the software development for the implementation of data storage, sharing and processing pipelines involving all consortium partners.
- Drive the digitalisation of data and standardisation of formats and contents, which needs to be compatible with existing systems.
- Contribute directly and make an impact on data processing in collaboration with the PI's of the NCCR and our partners NCCR MARVEL (http://nccr-marvel.ch/), SDSC (https://datascience.ch/), and CSCS (https://www.cscs.ch/).
- Ensure the associated maintenance and support, once standardization and software are established.
- Advise, train and support the participating NCCR laboratories at EPFL, ETHZ and partner institutions in all questions around data science.
Your profile :
- PhD degree in Science or Engineering.
- At least three years of experience in software-related positions (building systems within the scope of a graduate degree counts towards these three years) with validated experience in large software architectures, data management and digitalisation.
- A previous experience in data science related to molecular sciences (chemistry, chemical engineering, materials, biology) is a strong asset.
- Capable of participating in multi-disciplinary teams involving participants with very low data management knowledge. Eagerness to perform training, support and maintenance work.
- Ability to conduct independent work and to work in a team as required by the task at hand.
- Excellent verbal English communication skills. Knowledge of French and German is an asset.
- Travel attitude (mainly within Switzerland: the NCCR central office will in particular have regular meetings in ETHZ in Zurich).
We offer :
- A unique occasion to participate to solving one of the major societal challenge of this century: a carbon neutral society.
- An opportunity to contribute to the growth of the emerging field of digital chemistry.
- A stimulating work environment including multiple research groups at EPFL, ETHZ, IBM, Swiss universities and applied universities and multiple partners in data science.
- Access to many continuing education courses.
- A competitive salary commensurate with skills and experience, and subject to EPFL pay scale. EPFL is an equal-opportunity employer.
- EPFL and ETHZ are international and world-class universities. They offer state-of-the-art facilities, scientific events and training and hosts a vibrant entrepreneurial community. Candidates will be recruited on merit only.
Start date : as soon as possible Term of employment : Unlimited (CDI) Work rate : 100% Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

job.title: Généraliste Ressources Humaines

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
L’Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), est l’un des campus universitaires les plus dynamiques en Europe et s’inscrit dans le top 20 mondial de nombreux classements académiques. L’EPFL compte près de 6'000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs qui font vivre les trois missions principales de l’Ecole : la formation, la recherche et l’innovation. Le campus de l’EPFL offre un cadre de travail exceptionnel au cœur d’une communauté de 16'000 personnes dont plus de 10'000 étudiants et 3500 chercheurs issus de 120 nationalités différentes.
Généraliste Ressources Humaines
Mission : Le/la généraliste RH (GRH) a pour mission de contribuer à la gestion des ressources humaines de la faculté des Sciences de Base (SB) et seconder la Responsable RH (RRH) de la faculté.Le/la GRH rapporte au RRH et collabore avec les Assistants,es RH, Gestionnaires salaires & assurances sociales, ainsi qu’avec le service RH en général, afin d’assurer sa mission et contribuer au développement de la fonction RH. Principales tâches et responsabilités :
- Gérer les recrutements du personnel administratif et technique non cadre et recommander les propositions de salaires - Revoir et recommander, le cas échéant, des changements d’échelons/fonctions en application du système salarial ou autres barèmes - Suivre et gérer pro activement les absences - Soutenir le RRH lors des ouvertures de laboratoires, de centres, dans l’engagement des collaborateurs concernés - Soutenir le RRH dans le suivi et la gestion des collaborateurs visés par les fermetures de laboratoires, de centres - Contribuer aux projets RH et représenter la faculté dans ces projets
La description n’a pas un caractère exhaustif et peut évoluer en fonction des besoins de l’institution et des changements d’organisation du département RH. Profil recherché :
- CFC de commerce, complété par un Brevet Fédéral de spécialiste RH ou éventuellement formation / expérience jugée équivalente - Bonne connaissance des cadres légaux et administratifs RH suisses - Une expérience confirmée en gestion RH; la connaissance du milieu académique est un plus - Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais indispensable - Excellentes compétences en communication, bon sens relationnel et orientation clients - Très bonne organisation et excellente capacité à gérer les priorités et esprit d’équipe
Nous offrons :
- Une ambiance de travail conviviale - Un environnement multiculturel stimulant
Date d'entrée en fonction : Dès que possible ou à convenir Type de contrat : Durée indéterminée (CDI) Taux d'occupation : 80-100% Durée : Indéterminée Remarque : Seuls les candidats ayant postulé via le site internet de l'EPFL ou celui de notre partenaire Jobup seront pris en compte.postuler en ligne

job.title: Software Engineer - Frontend at Buildigo
job.plaincontent:
Your position
You will join a talented engineering team focused on building a high quality product. Our engineers have a continuous delivery oriented mindset. They come up with ideas to improve the product, they prototype them and see them through in production and measure their impact. Very high standards of quality, automation and security are part of our DNA.
Your position entails a high level of responsibility within the engineering team. Your contribution will have a significant impact on the satisfaction of thousands of users. As a Software Engineer, your responsibilities will include the following:
- Design, implement and validate solutions for new features in our different frontends - Maintain the highest code quality standards and help the team to improve its best practices in development - Write maintainable, elegant and testable code - Contribute to the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines - Work with an agile iterative/incremental mindset
Your profile
- 3-5+ years of hands-on experience in Frontend Software Engineering - BSc or MSc in Computer Science (or equivalent) - Experience with modern frontend frameworks (Angular, React or Vue). Angular experience is a big plus - Very strong technical background, with clear focus on web technologies - Strong programming skills and ability to code in TypeScript. Node.JS is a plus - Expertise with CSS and CSS libraries (Tailwind, Bootstrap, …) is a must - Knowledge of cloud native, serverless, containers, AWS and Amplify is a plus - Teamwork, collaboration and entrepreneurial mindset is part of your DNA - You take initiatives and have a «can-do» attitude - Strong motivation for complex challenges and learning new technologies - You are fluent in English - You have a Swiss / EU passport or a work permit for Switzerland
What we have to offer
- A dynamic, ambitious and passionate team with significant experience when it comes to building a product that makes a difference - The agility and excitement of a startup, coupled with the support of La Mobilière in the background - A lot of independence, autonomy and responsibilities - Significant development opportunities - Nice offices in Bern with the possibility of working from home - Your choice of hardware
Your recruitment process
- Send your CV to Mathieu Meylan, CTO at Buildigo (mathieu.meylan@buildigo.ch) and he’ll get back to you within 3 working days - You’ll be invited for a virtual or onsite coffee meeting. - As a next step you would get to know the team, combined with an assignment and presentation at Buildigo - If things go well, you’ll receive an offer within a month
Ihr Kontakt
Lea Schmid
0041 31 389 63 30 Recruiting / Sourcing lea.schmid1@mobi.ch die Mobiliar
Cicero - Beratungsqualität und Weiterbildung
Wir wollen unseren Kundinnen und Kunden eine Beratung in Top-Qualität bieten. Darum lernen wir kontinuierlich dazu. Wir bilden uns weiter und halten uns fachlich fit.
Arbeiten auf der Generalagentur
Die Jobs auf unseren Generalagenturen sind so vielseitig wie die Mitarbeitenden. Unsere Mitarbeitenden geben Einblick in ihre Tätigkeit.
job.htmlcontent:
Your position

You will join a talented engineering team focused on building a high quality product. Our engineers have a continuous delivery oriented mindset. They come up with ideas to improve the product, they prototype them and see them through in production and measure their impact. Very high standards of quality, automation and security are part of our DNA.

Your position entails a high level of responsibility within the engineering team. Your contribution will have a significant impact on the satisfaction of thousands of users. As a Software Engineer, your responsibilities will include the following:

  • Design, implement and validate solutions for new features in our different frontends
  • Maintain the highest code quality standards and help the team to improve its best practices in development
  • Write maintainable, elegant and testable code
  • Contribute to the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines
  • Work with an agile iterative/incremental mindset 

Your profile

  • 3-5+ years of hands-on experience in Frontend Software Engineering
  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science (or equivalent)
  • Experience with modern frontend frameworks (Angular, React or Vue). Angular experience is a big plus
  • Very strong technical background, with clear focus on web technologies
  • Strong programming skills and ability to code in TypeScript. Node.JS is a plus
  • Expertise with CSS and CSS libraries (Tailwind, Bootstrap, …) is a must
  • Knowledge of cloud native, serverless, containers, AWS and Amplify is a plus
  • Teamwork, collaboration and entrepreneurial mindset is part of your DNA
  • You take initiatives and have a «can-do» attitude
  • Strong motivation for complex challenges and learning new technologies
  • You are fluent in English
  • You have a Swiss / EU passport or a work permit for Switzerland

What we have to offer

  • A dynamic, ambitious and passionate team with significant experience when it comes to building a product that makes a difference
  • The agility and excitement of a startup, coupled with the support of La Mobilière in the background
  • A lot of independence, autonomy and responsibilities
  • Significant development opportunities
  • Nice offices in Bern with the possibility of working from home
  • Your choice of hardware

Your recruitment process

  1. Send your CV to Mathieu Meylan, CTO at Buildigo (mathieu.meylan@buildigo.ch) and he’ll get back to you within 3 working days
  2. You’ll be invited for a virtual or onsite coffee meeting.
  3. As a next step you would get to know the team, combined with an assignment and presentation at Buildigo
  4. If things go well, you’ll receive an offer within a month

Ihr Kontakt

Lea Schmid

0041 31 389 63 30
Recruiting / Sourcing
lea.schmid1@mobi.ch die Mobiliar

Cicero - Beratungsqualität und Weiterbildung

Wir wollen unseren Kundinnen und Kunden eine Beratung in Top-Qualität bieten. Darum lernen wir kontinuierlich dazu. Wir bilden uns weiter und halten uns fachlich fit.

Arbeiten auf der Generalagentur

Die Jobs auf unseren Generalagenturen sind so vielseitig wie die Mitarbeitenden. Unsere Mitarbeitenden geben Einblick in ihre Tätigkeit.

job.title: Cloud Software Engineer - Backend at Buildigo
job.plaincontent:
Your position
You will join a talented engineering team focused on building a high quality product. Our engineers have a continuous delivery oriented mindset. They come up with ideas to improve the product, they prototype them and see them through in production and measure their impact. Very high standards of quality, automation and security are part of our DNA. Your position entails a high level of responsibility within the engineering team. As a Software Engineer, your responsibilities will include the following:
- Design, implement and validate solutions for new features in our different systems - Maintain the highest code quality standards and help the team to improve its best practices in development - Write maintainable, elegant and testable code - Contribute to the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines - Work with an agile iterative/incremental mindset
Your profile
- 3-5+ years of hands-on experience in Software Engineering - BSc or MSc in Computer Science (or equivalent) - Very strong technical background, with clear focus on web technologies - Strong programming skills and ability to code in TypeScript and Node.JS - Expertise with at least one SQL database (Postgres, MySQL, …) - Deep understanding on how to build cloud native software in AWS - Experience with serverless, Lambda, CDK, DynamoDB and Docker containers is a big plus - Knowledge of event driven architecture and event buses is highly valued - Teamwork and collaboration is part of your DNA - You take initiatives and have a «can-do» attitude - Strong motivation for complex challenges and learning new technologies - You are fluent in English - You have a Swiss / EU passport or a work permit for Switzerland
What we have to offer
- A dynamic, ambitious and passionate team with significant experience when it comes to building a product that makes a difference - The agility and excitement of a startup, coupled with the support of La Mobilière in the background - A lot of independence, autonomy and responsibilities - Significant development opportunities - Nice offices in Bern with the possibility of working from home - Your choice of hardware
Your recruitment process
- Send your CV to Mathieu Meylan, CTO at Buildigo (mathieu.meylan@buildigo.ch) and he’ll get back to you within 3 working days - You’ll be invited for a virtual or onsite coffee meeting - As a next step you would get to know the team, combined with an assignment and presentation at Buildigo - If things go well, you’ll receive an offer within a month
Ihr Kontakt
Lea Schmid
0041 31 389 63 30 Recruiting / Sourcing lea.schmid1@mobi.ch die Mobiliar

job.htmlcontent:
Your position

You will join a talented engineering team focused on building a high quality product. Our engineers have a continuous delivery oriented mindset. They come up with ideas to improve the product, they prototype them and see them through in production and measure their impact. Very high standards of quality, automation and security are part of our DNA.
Your position entails a high level of responsibility within the engineering team. As a Software Engineer, your responsibilities will include the following:

  • Design, implement and validate solutions for new features in our different systems
  • Maintain the highest code quality standards and help the team to improve its best practices in development 
  • Write maintainable, elegant and testable code 
  • Contribute to the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines 
  • Work with an agile iterative/incremental mindset 

Your profile

  • 3-5+ years of hands-on experience in Software Engineering
  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science (or equivalent)
  • Very strong technical background, with clear focus on web technologies
  • Strong programming skills and ability to code in TypeScript and Node.JS
  • Expertise with at least one SQL database (Postgres, MySQL, …)
  • Deep understanding on how to build cloud native software in AWS
  • Experience with serverless, Lambda, CDK, DynamoDB and Docker containers is a big plus
  • Knowledge of event driven architecture and event buses is highly valued
  • Teamwork and collaboration is part of your DNA
  • You take initiatives and have a «can-do» attitude
  • Strong motivation for complex challenges and learning new technologies
  • You are fluent in English
  • You have a Swiss / EU passport or a work permit for Switzerland

What we have to offer

  • A dynamic, ambitious and passionate team with significant experience when it comes to building a product that makes a difference
  • The agility and excitement of a startup, coupled with the support of La Mobilière in the background
  • A lot of independence, autonomy and responsibilities
  • Significant development opportunities
  • Nice offices in Bern with the possibility of working from home
  • Your choice of hardware

Your recruitment process

  1. Send your CV to Mathieu Meylan, CTO at Buildigo (mathieu.meylan@buildigo.ch) and he’ll get back to you within 3 working days
  2. You’ll be invited for a virtual or onsite coffee meeting
  3. As a next step you would get to know the team, combined with an assignment and presentation at Buildigo
  4. If things go well, you’ll receive an offer within a month

job.title: Kauffrau / Kaufmann EFZ E-Profil
job.plaincontent:
Departement Volkswirtschaft und Inneres
Amt für Justizvollzug / Jugendheim AarburgDas Jugendheim Aarburg hat per 1. August 2021 eine Lehrstelle zu besetzen als
Kauffrau / Kaufmann EFZ E-Profil
Aarburg
Wir bieten Ihnen
- Eine vielseitige und umfassende Ausbildung als Kauffrau / Kaufmann in der Branche Dienstleistung und Administration - Eine interessante und anspruchsvolle Lehrzeit - Individuelle Betreuung, abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeiten in den administrativen, anspruchsvollen Verwaltungsaufgaben und im HR-Bereich
Sie bringen mit
- Bezirks- oder guter Sekundarschulabschluss - gute mündliche und schriftliche Sprachgewandtheit - Lern- und Leistungsbereitschaft - Freude an exakter und selbstständiger Arbeitsweise - Kundenorientiertes Verhalten und Teamfähigkeit - Gepflegte Erscheinung, gute Umgangsformen und einwandfreier Leumund
Lehrzeit: 1. August 2021 bis 31. Juli 2024
Wir freuen uns über Ihre Online Bewerbung mit folgenden Unterlagen:
- Motivationsschreiben - Lebenslauf - sämtliche Oberstufenzeugnisse - Multi- oder Basic-Check, Check S2, Check S3 - Diplome, Schnupperberichte etc.
Lernen Sie uns kennen
Unsere Mitarbeitenden gestalten die Zukunft des Kantons Aargau mit: Dafür bieten die fünf Departemente, die Gerichte und die Staatskanzlei interessante Aufgaben und Möglichkeiten in den unterschiedlichsten Bereichen.Wir betreuen im Jugendheim Aarburg Jugendliche, die zum Vollzug von zivil- oder jugendstrafrechtlichen Massnahmen eingewiesen werden. Wir bieten eine erzieherische und therapeutische Betreuung an und bereiten die Jugendlichen mit gezielten schulischen und beruflichen Angeboten auf ein selbstverantwortliches und deliktfreies Leben vor.
Wir stellen uns vor
Mein Arbeitgeber
Wir bieten Ihnen eine spannende Herausforderungen in einem nicht alltäglichen Arbeitsgebiet. Interessiert? Mehr über uns und Ihre zukünftigen Kolleginnen und Kollegen finden Sie unter www.ag.ch/personal
Kontakt
Auskünfte erteilt Ihnen gerne Iris Blum, Berufsbildnerin, 062 787 01 01.
Weitere Stellenangebote:
SuchenIst diese Stelle nicht, was Sie suchen? Im Stellenportal finden Sie weitere interessante Stellenangebote des Arbeitgebers Kanton Aargau. Folgen Sie uns auf LinkedIn und Xing , um auf dem Laufenden zu bleiben!

job.title: Dipl. Pflegefachfrau/-mann mit Schwerpunkt Psychiatrie für das Modellprojekt Mobile Akutbehandlung 80 - 100 %
job.plaincontent:
Ambulant vor stationär! Wir starten ein innovatives Projekt mit einem völlig neuen Team für die Akut-Behandlung im Wohnumfeld und suchen dafür per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung in Langenthal eine/n
Dipl. Pflegefachfrau/-mann mit Schwerpunkt Psychiatrie für das Modellprojekt Mobile Akutbehandlung 80 - 100 %
Spital Langenthal
Ihre Aufgaben
Sie behandeln und betreuen psychisch erkrankte Menschen, für die eine stationäre Behandlung angezeigt ist, in ihrem Lebensumfeld zu Hause. Sie helfen, die Selbstständigkeit zu entwickeln und die Gesundheit zu fördern. Sie beziehen als wichtige Ressource das soziale Umfeld mit ein. Sie sind Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams, in welchem die Fallführung dual pflegerisch-ärztlich aufgestellt ist. Auch die Teamleitung ist durch eine ärztlich-pflegerische Co-Leitung abgedeckt.
Ihr Profil
Sie bringen Erfahrung in der Sozial- oder Akutpsychiatrie mit. Gegenüber Menschen in schwierigen Lebenssituationen sind Sie offen und sind bereit, gemeinsam mit den Betroffenen sowie ihrem Umfeld nach Lösungen zu suchen. Sie wollen sich sozialpsychiatrisch engagieren und bringen Interesse für die Weiterentwicklung des Projekts mit. Sie arbeiten patienten- und teamorientiert. Eine Prise Humor rundet ihr Profil ab.
Wir bieten
Selbstständiges Arbeiten mit enger Einbettung ins neu aufgestellte Team. Gute Fortbildungsmöglichkeiten und Supervision. Moderne sowie zeitgemässe Arbeits- und Anstellungsbedingungen.
Kontakt
Weitere Auskünfte erteilt Ihnen gerne Herr Giovanni Wildbolz, Co-Bereichsleiter Pflege Home Treatment, T 079 759 00 26, g.wildbolz@sro.ch oder Frau Michaela Wetzel, Stv. Co-Bereichsleiterin Pflege Home Treatment, T 079 539 12 76, m.wetzel@sro.ch
Ihre schriftliche Bewerbung richten Sie bitte an die SRO AG, Frau Julia Dubach, Human Resources, St. Urbanstrasse 67, CH-4900 Langenthal, job@sro.ch

job.title: Spécialiste calculation CVS senior
job.plaincontent:
Spécialiste calculation CVS senior
En tant que l’un des leaders Suisse en développement immobilier et entreprise générale et totale,Steiner se distingue par une solide responsabilisation des collaborateurs, un profond esprit d’équipe et un fort potentiel de développement.
AFIN DE RENFORCER NOTRE DEPARTEMENT"GENERAL PLANNING"DANS LA REGION ROMANDE, NOUSRECHERCHONS UN/UNE:
Spécialiste calculation CVS senior
Tes tâches
Directement rattaché au Responsable Chiffrage CVSE du département General Planning, tu participes à la réponse aux appels d’offres en chiffrant les projets de grande envergure allant de 10MF à 200MF en neuf ou réhabilitation
Tu vérifies et/ou réalises les dimensionnements d'installations, réalises la conception des installations lors des projets en conception-réalisation et préconises les solutions techniques avantageuses
- Etre garant de la fiabilité des couts - Vérifier l'exhaustivité et la faisabilité du dossier d'étude - Identifier et quantifier le potentiel d'économies sur les projets en proposant des variantes et des optimisations - Consulter les entreprises sous-traitantes - Rédiger les mémoires techniques - Apporter un support régulier au département des Travaux et Achats
Ton profil
- Technicien, Ingénieur ou chef de projet confirmé, vous avez une expérience dans la gestion de projets de 5 ans minimum - Expérienceen conception/études de prix - Excellentes connaissances des normes et du marché suisses - Personne précise, rapide, rigoureuse avec un sens aigu des chiffres, curieuse, avec un très bon esprit d’équipe - Utilisateur confirmé de Win Progitel et d’Autocad, connaissances de Revit un plus - Français langue maternelle, Anglais et/ou Allemand un atout
Tes perspectives et avantages
Auprès de Steiner SA, tu joues un rôle important et prends des responsabilités. Tu peux déployer tes capacités et faire valoir activement tes idées. Chez nous, c’est une fonction passionnante, variée et pouvant évoluer, ainsi que des perspectives intéressantes qui t’attendent. Notre environnement de travail est marqué par l’esprit d’équipe. Il correspond à celui d’une entreprise reconnue et ayant du succès. Nous t’offrons en outre des conditions de travail modernes. Tu profites en plus d’opportunités de perfectionnement et de formation continue ainsi que d’une place de travail bien située. Tu bénéficies également de prestations très avantageuses. Tu peux en apprendre plus ici .
Si tu te sens concerné(e) par ce nouveau défi, clique sur «postuler maintenant». Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir ta postulation !
Steiner SA | Human Resources Route de Lully 5 | 1131 Tolochenaz
